001package squidpony;
002
003import java.util.HashMap;
004import java.util.Map;
005import squidpony.annotation.Beta;
006
007/**
008 * The Damerau-Levenshtein Algorithm is an extension to the Levenshtein
009 * Algorithm which solves the edit distance problem between a source string and
010 * a target string with the following operations:
011 *
012 * <ul>
013 * <li>Character Insertion</li>
014 * <li>Character Deletion</li>
015 * <li>Character Replacement</li>
016 * <li>Adjacent Character Swap</li>
017 * </ul>
018 *
019 * Note that the adjacent character swap operation is an edit that may be
020 * applied when two adjacent characters in the source string match two adjacent
021 * characters in the target string, but in reverse order, rather than a general
022 * allowance for adjacent character swaps.
023 *
024 * This implementation allows the client to specify the costs of the various
025 * edit operations with the restriction that the cost of two swap operations
026 * must not be less than the cost of a delete operation followed by an insert
027 * operation. This restriction is required to preclude two swaps involving the
028 * same character being required for optimality which, in turn, enables a fast
029 * dynamic programming solution.
030 *
031 * The running time of the Damerau-Levenshtein algorithm is O(n*m) where n is
032 * the length of the source string and m is the length of the target string.
033 * This implementation consumes O(n*m) space.
034 * 
035* @author Kevin L. Stern
036 */
037@Beta
038public class DamerauLevenshteinAlgorithm {
039
040    private final int deleteCost, insertCost, replaceCost, swapCost;
041
042    /**
043     * Constructor.
044     *     
045* @param deleteCost the cost of deleting a character.
046     * @param insertCost the cost of inserting a character.
047     * @param replaceCost the cost of replacing a character.
048     * @param swapCost the cost of swapping two adjacent characters.
049     */
050    public DamerauLevenshteinAlgorithm(int deleteCost, int insertCost, int replaceCost, int swapCost) {
051        /*
052         * Required to facilitate the premise to the algorithm that two swaps of
053         * the same character are never required for optimality.
054         */
055        if (2 * swapCost < insertCost + deleteCost) {
056            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Unsupported cost assignment");
057        }
058        this.deleteCost = deleteCost;
059        this.insertCost = insertCost;
060        this.replaceCost = replaceCost;
061        this.swapCost = swapCost;
062    }
063
064    /**
065     * Compute the Damerau-Levenshtein distance between the specified source
066     * string and the specified target string.
067     */
068    public int execute(String source, String target) {
069        if (source.length() == 0) {
070            return target.length() * insertCost;
071        }
072
073        if (target.length() == 0) {
074            return source.length() * deleteCost;
075        }
076
077        int[][] table = new int[source.length()][target.length()];
078        Map<Character, Integer> sourceIndexByCharacter = new HashMap<>();
079
080        if (source.charAt(0) != target.charAt(0)) {
081            table[0][0] = Math.min(replaceCost, deleteCost + insertCost);
082        }
083
084        sourceIndexByCharacter.put(source.charAt(0), 0);
085
086        for (int i = 1; i < source.length(); i++) {
087            int deleteDistance = table[i - 1][0] + deleteCost;
088            int insertDistance = (i + 1) * deleteCost + insertCost;
089            int matchDistance = i * deleteCost
090                    + (source.charAt(i) == target.charAt(0) ? 0 : replaceCost);
091            table[i][0] = Math.min(Math.min(deleteDistance, insertDistance),
092                    matchDistance);
093        }
094
095        for (int j = 1; j < target.length(); j++) {
096            int deleteDistance = table[0][j - 1] + insertCost;
097            int insertDistance = (j + 1) * insertCost + deleteCost;
098            int matchDistance = j * insertCost
099                    + (source.charAt(0) == target.charAt(j) ? 0 : replaceCost);
100            table[0][j] = Math.min(Math.min(deleteDistance, insertDistance),
101                    matchDistance);
102        }
103
104        for (int i = 1; i < source.length(); i++) {
105            int maxSourceLetterMatchIndex = source.charAt(i) == target
106                    .charAt(0) ? 0 : -1;
107            for (int j = 1; j < target.length(); j++) {
108                Integer candidateSwapIndex = sourceIndexByCharacter.get(target
109                        .charAt(j));
110                int jSwap = maxSourceLetterMatchIndex;
111                int deleteDistance = table[i - 1][j] + deleteCost;
112                int insertDistance = table[i][j - 1] + insertCost;
113                int matchDistance = table[i - 1][j - 1];
114                if (source.charAt(i) != target.charAt(j)) {
115                    matchDistance += replaceCost;
116                } else {
117                    maxSourceLetterMatchIndex = j;
118                }
119                int swapDistance;
120                if (candidateSwapIndex != null && jSwap != -1) {
121                    int iSwap = candidateSwapIndex;
122                    int preSwapCost;
123                    if (iSwap == 0 && jSwap == 0) {
124                        preSwapCost = 0;
125                    } else {
126                        preSwapCost = table[Math.max(0, iSwap - 1)][Math.max(0,
127                                jSwap - 1)];
128                    }
129                    swapDistance = preSwapCost + (i - iSwap - 1) * deleteCost
130                            + (j - jSwap - 1) * insertCost + swapCost;
131                } else {
132                    swapDistance = Integer.MAX_VALUE;
133                }
134                table[i][j] = Math.min(
135                        Math.min(Math.min(deleteDistance, insertDistance),
136                                matchDistance), swapDistance);
137            }
138            sourceIndexByCharacter.put(source.charAt(i), i);
139        }
140        return table[source.length() - 1][target.length() - 1];
141    }
142}
